claim: Wikidata allows adding qualifiers to statements which allowed us to define a data model for citations annotated with CiTO intention; the Wikidata property P3712 has been used for this, labeled objective of project or action (see Fig. 1; this property was relabeled in November 2022 as has goal).
title: Fig. 1.
caption: Screenshot of the citation statements for an article where the objective of project or action qualifier is used to annotate the citation with their CiTO intentions

claim: To continue, the current number of citations are citing 387 articles in 141 different scholarly journals, and they are found in 98 articles in 48 different journals (see Fig. 2) [13].
title: Fig. 2.
caption: Screenshot of the Scholia Citation Typing Ontology page showing the daily statistics

claim: Figure 3 shows a method reuse network for articles with explicit annotation in red.
title: Fig. 3.
caption: Citation network consisting only of citations annotated with [cito:usesMethodIn]. Articles with explicit CiTO annotation are shown in red. The Wikidata SPARQL query used to create this diagram is available from https://gist.github.com/egonw/1c8bc99373a24075838ee19976c74856

claim: Figure 4 shows a tabular summary of articles of which methods or data is reused.
title: Fig. 4.
caption: Screenshot of the “Most reused articles” section of the Scholia page for the Journal of Cheminformatics. Based on CiTO annotation available in Wikidata, the ten most reused articles are shown
